glsa.title: shadow: Privilege escalation
glsa.synopsis: A security issue in shadow allows a local user to perform certain actions with escalated privileges.

background.p: shadow provides a set of utilities to deal with user accounts.

description.p: When the mailbox is created in useradd, the "open()" function does not receive the three arguments it expects while O_CREAT is present, which leads to random permissions on the created file, before fchmod() is executed.

impact.p: Depending on the random permissions given to the mailbox file which is at this time owned by root, a local user may be able to open this file for reading or writing, or even executing it, maybe as the root user.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
